title: Avoid exponential blowup in size of Builder type
body:
See the comment added to builder.rs for the juicy details, but the tl;dr is that by *not* calling a shared internal function in the various `ElementBuilder` entrypoints, we avoid an exponential explosion in the size of the resulting Builder object type and thereby dodge limits on mangled symbol size.

An alternative solution would be recommending using `v0` name mangling (`RUSTFLAGS=-Csymbol-mangling-version=v0`) but that seems less convenient for users and anyway we should probably avoid generating exponential types in case the compiler takes a peek and gets very sad and slow.

This is kind of hard to add an automatic (stress) test for, as testing requires poking the generated `.wasm` file to see if any of the mangled names are looking exponential-ish.

body: API Docs fix #578.

title: Fix Issue #572
body:
This fixes the panic described in #572.

It removes the loop that unwraps inner dynamic views from the render code for `ViewType::Dyn`. I don't understand its purpose in the first place, no tests failed after removing it, TodoMVC still works exactly as expected and even my contrived example to specifically trigger that loop renders and updates perfectly fine. So I can only assume it was extraneous code left over from a refactor.

title: Fix missing `View::new_dyn_scoped` check at the root
body:
Currently, if the `cx` identifier is found inside the dynamic node expression, `View::new_dyn_scoped` is used instead of `View::new_dyn`. This is just like the difference between `create_effect_scoped` and `create_effect`, where the former creates a new nested reactive scope.

Dynamic expressions which are nested under elements already perform this check correctly. With the templates refactor in #536, I forgot to re-add this check when the dynamic node is created at the root. This PR adds this check.

title: Allow passing through attributes on components

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: new feature or improvement to existing feature

body:
This allows a component to take in a map of arguments so they can be passed through to an inner HTML element.
The current syntax proposal is the following:

# Passing attributes

Any prefixed "props" (`on:`, `bind:`) will be automatically passed through. For attributes that don't have a built in prefix, `attr:` can be added to pass it through.

## Example:
The class and on click event will be passed through via `Attributes`, `is_accessible` is a regular prop.
```rust
view! { cx, Label(attr:class = "bg-gray-400", on:click = on_click, is_accessible = true) { "Name" } }
```

# Applying attributes to elements

Applying will be done with Rust's "rest" operator.

## Example:
```rust
view! { cx, label(..attributes, id = aria_id) { (children) } }
```

# Example Use Case
[Accessible Checkbox](https://github.com/wingertge/headlessui-sycamore/blob/master/src/components/checkbox.rs)

# Current status

The code is very suboptimal and documentation will be added when the feature is done. The following parts of the feature are currently done:
- [x] The `Attribute` struct and `AttributeValue` enum required to pass through values in a type safe way
- [x] Parsing prefixed props as attributes and generating the `Attribute` struct from them
- [x] Applying attributes to an element
- [x] Tests
- [x] Cleanup and documentation
- [x] More ergonomic way to get values from `Attributes`
- [x] Example
- [x] Book documentation

title: Implement ToView manually for types

labels.name: BREAKING CHANGE
labels.description: Breaking changes introduced in this PR

body:
This lets us do some nice things such as:
```rust
let show = true;
view! { cx,
    (show.then(|| view! { cx, "Hello!" }))
}
```

**Breaking Changes:**
- `IntoView` renamed to `ToView` (which is more idiomatic in Rust)
- `IntoView::create` renamed to `ToView::to_view`
- Not all types that implement `Display` now implement `ToView`. For those types that used to implement `IntoView` but do not now implement `ToView`, a simple fix would be to just add a `to_string()` at the call-site.

title: Prevent re-running effects inside themselves
body: Fixes #538

title: (Runtime) Templates

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: new feature or improvement to existing feature

body:
Closes #19 

Adds a template system where `Template` represents the structure of the `view!` with holes inside. These holes can then be binded to and filled in with the dynamic values.

This should give a big performance boost on the client side because we are cloning templates now instead of creating each and every element individually.
This could also give a performance boost on server-side by allowing us to cache the SSR-ed strings.

This also unlocks other exciting features such as some form of hot view-reloading.

Remove legacy component syntax and introduce `Component` trait

labels.description: Breaking changes introduced in this PR

body: Closes #509 and #493

title: Make `Option<T>` prop fields optional by default
body:
Optional fields by default, opt-out by setting `#[prop(!optional)]`.

Example:
```rust
#[derive(Props)]
struct Props {
    #[prop(!optional, setter(strip_option))]
    required: Option<()>,
    optional: Option<()>,
}

// Compiles
Props::builder()
    .required(())
    .build();
```

Closes #483.

title: Remove redundant set_value in todomvc example
body: It seems that setting the value of the input field does not affect the behavior of the program in any way

title: adding `set_fn` and `set_fn_silent`
body:
Hey there! :)

I thought a convenience function like `change` would be nice in order to avoid needing a `state.get()` call for simple use cases. This is done in `solidjs` as well: https://www.solidjs.com/tutorial/introduction_signals

Let me know if there are any changes you'd like made :)

P.S., I chose `Fn(&T) -> T` to avoid requiring `Copy` or `Clone` on T. This is only really intended for the simplest situations.

title: Simplify the TodoMVC example code
body: Slightly shortens the code and removes a few instances of manually data binding and js type casts when they are unnecessary.

title: `GenericNode` v2

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: new feature or improvement to existing feature

labels.name: BREAKING CHANGE
labels.description: Breaking changes introduced in this PR

labels.name: A-SSR
labels.description: Area: Server Side Rendering (SSR) and Static Site Generation (SSG)

body:
# Changes

- **BREAKING**: remove `inner_element` methods from `DomNode` and `HydrateNode` and move to `Html` trait.
- **BREAKING**: Move element creation methods to new `GenericNodeElements` trait.
- **BREAKING**: Use `Cow<str>` instead of `&str` everywhere in `GenericNode`.
- **BREAKING**: Make `from_web_sys` a trait method on `Html`.
- Make the baes view/node macros backend independent and re-export HTML specific macros.

Although it seems like there are a lot of breaking changes, most users won't be affected because these are mostly low-level APIs which are rarely used directly.

title: Make `create_ref` only allow `T: 'static`

labels.name: BREAKING CHANGE
labels.description: Breaking changes introduced in this PR

body:
Fixes #494 

Closes #400 (basically makes the code pattern impossible)

This essentially makes `create_ref` only work on `'static` types which completely prevents the issue mentioned in #494.

Unfortunately this makes `create_ref` much less powerful, but in practice, it seems like this won't be too big of a setback. In fact, none of the examples needed to be modified.
